title: January 6 Capitol Attack
summary: Trump urged supporters to 'fight like hell' before mob stormed the Capitol, resulting in 5 deaths, 140+ injured officers, and his second impeachment for 'incitement of insurrection.'
keyFacts: Urged supporters to march to Capitol and 'fight like hell'
5 people died in connection with the attack
140+ police officers injured, including concussions and traumatic brain injuries
Rioters erected gallows and chanted 'Hang Mike Pence!'
Trump attacked Pence while mob was hunting him: 'Mike Pence didn't have the courage'
Impeached for 'incitement of insurrection' (10 Republicans voted to impeach)
7 Republican senators voted to convict - most bipartisan impeachment vote in history
Over 1,500 people subsequently charged with federal crimes
Trump later pardoned ~1,500 January 6 defendants including violent offenders
